description: Tartar is an elaboration where a raw product is used, this type of elaboration is much more sensitive to causing toxiinfections since by not passing through a heat source we do not eliminate possible parasites or bacteria.
items: First of all, it is important to freeze the piece of salmon a minimum of 48h at -18 Â° C, to make sure to eliminate the risk of toxic infections.
Once thawed, carry out the marinade.
In a bowl put the salt, sugar, the crushed peppercorns and a couple of fresh dill sprouts; then mix everything.
Cover the piece of salmon on all sides with the previous mixture, film and let it marinate for 12-24 hours depending on the thickness of the piece of salmon.
To remove the salmon from the marinade, rinse it in cold water and dry it well.
Before cutting the salmon, remove the skin and fat (meat of a grayish tone).
To have a nice tartar, the most important thing is that the main elements (salmon, avocado and mango) have the same cut and size. To do this, cut these three into small cubes.
Remember that the avocado rusts quickly, as soon as it is cut, add a few drops of lemon juice, a drizzle of virgin oil and a pinch of salt.
To finish it, cut the chives very finely.
Now is the time to put it all together in a bowl and dress it with: sweet soy, sesame oil, extra virgin olive oil and salt if necessary.
Once the desired flavor is found, leave it to marinate in the refrigerator for about 20 min. And we will have it ready to eat.
